required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Visual Feedback Therapy for Treating Individuals With Hemiparesis Following Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Visual Feedback Therapy for Treating Individuals With Hemiparesis Following Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine whether an existing treatment for problems that participants have with making movements after a stroke can be performed at home.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will compare two forms of home-based treatment for post-stroke problems making movements with the arms and hands. After initial pre-treatment assessments, participants will complete 4 weeks of treatment, with assessments after each week of treatment and 3 months after the completion of treatment.

primary_outcome.description: This test measures impairment-level ability to move the arm and hand. Scores range from 0 to 66, with higher scores indicating greater ability to move the arm and hand.
The test measures the ability to complete simulated everyday tasks with the arm. Scores range from 0 to 54, with higher scores indicating better performance.
This test measures the integrity of sensory perception of the arm. The score is the proportion of items answered correctly, and ranges from 0 to 1 with higher scores indicating better performance.

This test measures the ability to detect lateralized attention problems in a simulated navigation test. Evidence for lateralized attentional problems was defined as a 20% difference in item detection between the left and right side.

secondary_outcome.description: This test measures the self-reported ability to complete everyday tasks with the arm. Total scores for all items are reported. The scale ranged from 0 to 300, with higher scores indicating higher self-reported ability.
The test measures the ability to completed simulated everyday tasks with the arm. The scale ranged from 0 to 75, with higher scores indicating better performance.

arm_group.description: 4 weeks of home-based mirror therapy. Participants practiced making movements with mirrored visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.
4 weeks of home-based divider therapy (control therapy to mirror therapy; mirror replaced by a divider). Participants practiced making movements with no visual feedback of the low-functioning arm.

intervention.description: A home-based therapy involving mirrored visual feedback
A home-based therapy involving removed visual feedback.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 6 months or more post-stroke
- upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score between 10 and 50
- no longer participating in upper-extremity physical or occupational therapy
- sufficient comprehension ability to understand instructions
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous head trauma, psychiatric illness or chronic exposure to medications that might be expected to have lasting consequences for the central nervous system (e.g., haloperidol, dopaminergics)
- dementia

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Mirror Therapy: High Functioning
group.description: 4 weeks of home-based mirror therapy. Participants practiced making movements with mirrored visual feedback of the low-functioning arm. High functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 30-50.

group.title: Mirror Therapy: Low Functioning
group.description: 4 weeks of home-based mirror therapy. Participants practiced making movements with mirrored visual feedback of the low-functioning arm. Low functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 10-29.

group.title: Divider Therapy: High Functioning
group.description: 4 weeks of home-based divider therapy (control therapy to mirror therapy; mirror replaced by a divider). Participants practiced making movements with no visual feedback of the low-functioning arm. High functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 30-50.

group.title: Divider Therapy: Low Functioning
group.description: 4 weeks of home-based divider therapy (control therapy to mirror therapy; mirror replaced by a divider). Participants practiced making movements with no visual feedback of the low-functioning arm. Low functioning was defined as pre-treatment upper extremity Fugl-Meyer score of 10-29.

measure.description: This test measures impairment-level ability to move the arm and hand. Scores range from 0 to 66, with higher scores indicating greater ability to move the arm and hand.

measure.description: The test measures the ability to complete simulated everyday tasks with the arm. Scores range from 0 to 54, with higher scores indicating better performance.

measure.description: The test measures the ability to completed simulated everyday tasks with the arm. The scale ranged from 0 to 75, with higher scores indicating better performance.

measure.description: This test measures the ability to detect lateralized attention problems in a simulated navigation test. Evidence for lateralized attentional problems was defined as a 20% difference in item detection between the left and right side.

outcome.description: This test measures impairment-level ability to move the arm and hand. Scores range from 0 to 66, with higher scores indicating greater ability to move the arm and hand.
outcome.population: All participants who started the treatment were included. Data for any participants who failed to complete the treatment were imputed.

measure.title: Upper Extremity Fugl-Meyer
measure.description: This test measures impairment-level ability to move the arm and hand. Scores range from 0 to 66, with higher scores indicating greater ability to move the arm and hand.
measure.population: All participants who started the treatment were included. Data for any participants who failed to complete the treatment were imputed.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Test for the superiority of Mirror therapy over Divider therapy.
analysis.p_value_desc: ANCOVA analysis with post-treatment score as the dependent variable, therapy type (Mirror therapy or Divider Therapy) as the independent variable, and pre-treatment score as the covariate. P-value reported is for the main effect of therapy type.

outcome.population: All participants who started the treatment were included. Data for any participants who failed to complete the treatment were imputed.

outcome.title: Virtual-reality Assessment of Navigation
outcome.description: This test measures the ability to detect lateralized attention problems in a simulated navigation test. Evidence for lateralized attentional problems was defined as a 20% difference in item detection between the left and right side.
outcome.population: No participants were administered the test in the post-treatment phase because no participant exhibited a baseline 20% difference in item detection between the left and right side.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
